page.title: 05 Meall Bhanabhie: Fauna 1
page.content: {Mainly Mammals} Each of the various habitats is characterised by its own fauna. Pine-wood animals and birds have colonised the recent extensive forestry plantations - pine martins being a notable example. On the woodland floor live wood mice, and bank voles. Roe deer, although difficult to see, are present in the woods. The most spectacular of highland wildlife - the Red deer, live on higher ground, but will visit gardens on the lower slopes in winter. Foxes live on the open hillside feeding on field voles, small birds and carrion. They are wary of man and are seldom seen.
